title: Enriching Data and Analysis in Economics with Real Life Experiences
The Outlook for the U.S. Economy and Monetary Policy
result: "After the March FOMC meeting, the Committee said that it 'does not expect it will be appropriate to reduce the target range until it has gained greater confidence that inflation is moving sustainably toward 2 percent.'"

title: Disinflation without a Rise in Unemployment?  What Is Different This Time Around
result: "As inflation rose and began to appear persistent, the FOMC rightly focused on restoring price stability, knowing that without price stability, the economy would not work for anyone and that high inflation would ultimately undermine the strength of the labor market."

title: The Outlook for the Economy and Monetary Policy
result: "At some point, the continued cooling of inflation and labor markets may make it appropriate to reduce the target range for the federal funds rate."
